title.rendered: Xperience has been named as an approved supplier for G-Cloud 12

content.rendered:
Xperience has been named as an approved supplier for G-Cloud 12, the Crown Commercial Service’s online marketplace for the public sector.

We have a long history of providing digital transformation solutions to our customers and being awarded a place on the G-Cloud 12 extends our ability to deliver outstanding digital solutions to the public sector.

Xperience, a specialist in digital transformation solutions for the public and private sector, are delighted to announce that we have been named as an approved supplier on Crown Commercial Service’s G-Cloud 12 framework.

Xperience will be focusing on delivering Cloud Hosting and Cloud Software solutions within the G-Cloud marketplace, including Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Patch Management as a Service (PMaaS) and our highly unique Security as a Service (SECaaS) product, which helps the public sector prepare, detect and respond to the latest cyber security threats.

G-Cloud 12 provides public bodies with access to over 3,500 approved suppliers to  simplify the procurement and delivery process the procurement process for both buyer and seller by avoiding the expense of entering into time-consuming tendering processes and  individual contracts.

Richard Kennedy, Director at Xperience commented “We are proud to announce that we have been selected as an approved supplier for the Government’s G-Cloud 12 framework. The stringent standards that are applied by G-Cloud is testament to the quality of our cloud offerings and our dedication to security and compliance. We have a long history of providing cloud solutions with over 3000+ users across multiple sectors on our cloud platforms – 95% of which would recommend us.”

“We look forward to working with G-Cloud and are excited to be bringing our services to an ever-widening network of customers.”

Find out more about our G-cloud services here >>>
